metadata.title: CVE-2021-46993 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: sched:Fix out-of-bound access in uclamp Util-clamp places tasks in differentbuckets based on their clamp values for performance reasons. However, thesize of buckets is currently computed using a rounding division, which canlead to an off-by-one error in some configurations. For instance, with 20buckets, the bucket size will be 1024/20=51. A task with a clamp of 1024will be mapped to bucket id 1024/51=20. Sadly, correct indexes are in range[0,19], hence leading to an out of bound memory access. Clamp the bucket idto fix the issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46993` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
